_note: Locked per DD-07 resolution (2026-02-23). v1.1.0: added AI_AGENT, API_PLATFORM per DD-10. Changes require DD entry + version bump.

providerTypes.label: Online Travel Agency
providerTypes.description: Books across multiple suppliers (e.g., Booking.com, Expedia).

providerTypes.label: Metasearch Engine
providerTypes.description: Aggregates prices from OTAs and direct suppliers (e.g., Google Flights, Kayak).

providerTypes.label: Direct Supplier
providerTypes.description: Airlines, hotel chains, car rental cos selling direct.

providerTypes.label: Content Platform
providerTypes.description: Travel content, blogs, guides (e.g., Lonely Planet, Nomadic Matt).

providerTypes.label: Social Platform
providerTypes.description: User-generated inspiration and sharing (e.g., Instagram, TikTok, Reddit).

providerTypes.label: Review Platform
providerTypes.description: Traveler reviews and ratings (e.g., TripAdvisor, Yelp).

providerTypes.label: Mapping Service
providerTypes.description: Maps, navigation, local search (e.g., Google Maps, Apple Maps).

providerTypes.label: Event Platform
providerTypes.description: Event discovery and ticketing (e.g., Eventbrite, Dice).

providerTypes.label: Destination Marketing Org
providerTypes.description: Tourism bureaus, CVBs, national tourism boards.

providerTypes.label: Forum / Community
providerTypes.description: Q&A and discussion (e.g., Reddit travel subs, Flyertalk).

providerTypes.label: Travel Fintech
providerTypes.description: Expense, currency, payment, insurance (e.g., Revolut, Wise).

providerTypes.label: Transit Service
providerTypes.description: Ground transport, rideshare, public transit info.

providerTypes.label: AI Travel Agent
providerTypes.description: Autonomous or semi-autonomous AI agent that plans, books, or manages travel on behalf of the user (e.g., Expedia Romie, Google AI Mode).

providerTypes.label: API / GDS Platform
providerTypes.description: Backend infrastructure providing programmatic access to travel inventory via API or GDS protocols (e.g., Amadeus, Sabre, Travelport).

providerTypes.label: Super App
providerTypes.description: Multi-function platform spanning many stages (e.g., Google, Grab). See DD-07.
providerTypes.guardrail: Nodes using SUPER_APP must declare ≥4 journeyStages and ≥3 capabilities. If fewer, use a more specific provider type.
